data.title: Find The Piece
data.statement: Output the position(s) of the piece [[C]] in chessboard coordinates (e.g.:- a1,h7), or {{NONE}} if there aren't any [[C]] pieces. Ignore any other pieces.

data.stubGenerator:
read c:string(1)
loop 8 read r:string(8)
write NONE
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A character [[C]], representing the piece you need to find.
<<Next 8 lines:>> A string of length 8, representing a row of the chessboard. An empty square is denoted by {{O}}.
data.outputDescription: The coordinates for the piece(s), separated by space, sorted by alphabetically by column a-h and then numerically by row 1-8 (e.g.:- a1 a2 b5 h1 is sorted), or {{NONE}} if there aren't any [[C]] pieces.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Output the position(s) of the piece C in chessboard coordinates (e.g.:- a1,h7), or NONE if there aren't any C pieces. Ignore any other pieces.
Input
Line 1: A character C, representing the piece you need to find.
Next 8 lines: A string of length 8, representing a row of the chessboard. An empty square is denoted by O.
Output
The coordinates for the piece(s), separated by space, sorted by alphabetically by column a-h and then numerically by row 1-8 (e.g.:- a1 a2 b5 h1 is sorted), or NONE if there aren't any C pieces.
Constraints
C ≠ O
Example
Input
P
OOOOOOOO
OOOOOOOO
OOOOOOOO
OOOOOOOO
OOOOPOOO
OOOOOOOO
OOOOOOOO
OOOOOOOO
Output
e4
